page.title: 01THE CROSSCRAKE AREA
page.content: {Crosscrake,}lying about{four miles{south}of{Kendal,}is part of the {civil parish}of{Stainton,}which also includes{Halfpenny}and{Barrows Green. The larger{ecclesiastical parish}of {St. Thomas, Crosscrake}covers an area which contains{Barrows Green, {Crosscrake}itself, the{eastern slopes of the{Helm, Low Park, Sedgwick}and {Stainton. Generally, the{landscape}has a{rolling}appearance - it is an area containing{several glacial moraines. {The Helm}(185 metres above sea level) is an{abrupt}height, which{dominates {the area. Very{little arable}cultivation takes place and{dairy}farming {predominates.
